data.name: b-packaged®
data.description: The b-packaged® card allows employees to make payments with their card as part of their fringe benefits, instead of their taxable income. Whilst also keeping track of spending and managing tax requirements.

constraints.additionalInfo: Saving for a large purchase: there may be adverse tax implications if you have a credit balance at the end of each fringe benefits tax year (31 March). Please contact your employer for more details.

features.additionalInfo: Available with Apple Pay, Samsung Pay, Google Pay, Fitbit Pay and Garmin Pay
Pay your bills using your card details
You can set up periodical payments.
Available to organisations with Public Benevolent Institute (PBI) status
Other than salary sacrifice portion of wages
features.additionalValue: No BPAY, cash withdrawals or deposits

features.additionalInfo: Make eftpos transactions, pay bills and set up direct debits.

You can make super contributions from your account. Additional contributions are treated as employer contributions (preserved funds) because they are coming out of your pre-tax income. Make sure aged-based superannuation limits aren’t exceeded.

eligibility.additionalValue: Available to staff of organisations with Public Benevolent Institute (PBI) status
eligibility.additionalInfo: Available to staff of organisations with Public Benevolent Institute (PBI) status

fees.name: Transaction Fee
fees.additionalValue: A 70c transaction fee may be charged for EFTPOS transactions where Cheque or Savings is chosen. EFTPOS transactions where Credit is chosen don’t attract transaction fees.

fees.name: Direct Debit Dishonour Fee
fees.additionalValue: Applies when a direct debit from your account is dishonoured due to insufficient available funds.

fees.name: Overdrawn Fee
fees.additionalValue: Applies where your account is overdrawn without prior arrangement with us. You will be charged this fee each day your account is debited and your account remains overdrawn at the end of the day.

fees.name: Periodical Payment Rejection Fee
fees.additionalValue: If you have established a periodical payment and we cannot make the payment due to insufficient funds in your account, then we will apply this fee after four (4) unsuccessful attempts on consecutive days.
